CircuitBreaker - Class in org.fishwife.jrugged
A CircuitBreaker can be used with a service to throttle traffic to a failed subsystem (particularly one we might not be able to monitor, such as a peer system which must be accessed over the network).
CircuitBreaker() - Constructor for class org.fishwife.jrugged.CircuitBreaker
Creates a CircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
CircuitBreaker(String) - Constructor for class org.fishwife.jrugged.CircuitBreaker
Creates a CircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
CircuitBreaker(FailureInterpreter) - Constructor for class org.fishwife.jrugged.CircuitBreaker
Creates a CircuitBreaker with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
CircuitBreaker(String, FailureInterpreter) - Constructor for class org.fishwife.jrugged.CircuitBreaker
Creates a CircuitBreaker with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
CircuitBreaker(String, CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception>) - Constructor for class org.fishwife.jrugged.CircuitBreaker
Creates a CircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and using the supplied CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.
CircuitBreaker(String, FailureInterpreter, CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception>) - Constructor for class org.fishwife.jrugged.CircuitBreaker
Creates a CircuitBreaker with the provided FailureInterpreter and using the provided CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.

Represents whether a CircuitBreaker is OPEN, HALF_CLOSED, or CLOSED.

CircuitBreakerException - Exception in org.fishwife.jrugged
This exception gets thrown by a CircuitBreaker if a wrapped call is disallowed by a tripped (OPEN) breaker.

DefaultFailureInterpreter - Class in org.fishwife.jrugged
Trips a CircuitBreaker if the number of failures in a given time window exceed a specified tolerance.
DefaultFailureInterpreter() - Constructor for class org.fishwife.jrugged.DefaultFailureInterpreter
Default constructor.
DefaultFailureInterpreter(int, long) - Constructor for class org.fishwife.jrugged.DefaultFailureInterpreter
Constructor that allows a tolerance for a certain number of failures within a given window of time without tripping.
DefaultFailureInterpreter(Class<? extends Throwable>[]) - Constructor for class org.fishwife.jrugged.DefaultFailureInterpreter
Constructor where we specify certain Throwable classes that will be ignored by the breaker and not be treated as failures (they will be passed through transparently without causing the breaker to trip).
DefaultFailureInterpreter(Class<? extends Throwable>[], int, long) - Constructor for class org.fishwife.jrugged.DefaultFailureInterpreter
Constructor where we specify tolerance and a set of ignored failures.

FailureInterpreter - Interface in org.fishwife.jrugged
